intro: Ebracteola derenbergiana, commonly known as the Dering's ebracteola, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and a short, unbranched stem that bears the inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
